meanings.definition: A system for transmitting facsimile messages over telephone lines.
meanings.sent1: I sent the document through the telefax to my colleague.
meanings.sent2: The office uses a telefax to quickly send important papers.
meanings.sent3: The telefax machine beeped loudly, surprising everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: The telefax connected us instantly, bridging the distance between us.
meanings.sent5: The telefax hummed to life, ready to deliver the message across the wires.

meanings.definition: To transmit a facsimile message using a telefax machine.
meanings.sent1: She will telefax the contract to the client for approval.
meanings.sent2: We need to telefax the signed form to the head office.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally telefaxed a funny doodle instead of the report.
meanings.sent4: The telefaxed message traveled through the wires like a silent messenger.
meanings.sent5: Telefaxing the information ensured a quick and secure delivery.
